alert.note: Alert for Penobscot; Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 23 at 6:56PM EST until December 24 at 6:49AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Portions of East Central and North Central Maine, including the following counties, in East Central Maine, Penobscot. In North Central Maine, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 655 PM EST, Rain and snowmelt is causing minor flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Lily Bay Road is down to one lane at Blair Hill Road in Greenville. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Millinocket, Greenville, Patten, Ripogenus, Mount Katahdin, East Millinocket, Medway, Monson, Mount Chase, Blanchard, White Cap Mountain, Baxter State Park, Frenchtown, Kokadjo, South Branch Pond, Lobster Township, Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument, Chesuncook, Lobster Lake and Northeast Carry.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
